page.title: 05Mollington Village Community
page.content: Mollingtons population is some 500 people,being a balanced community of old locals,the older residents (20 years plus) and the new generation / transients of 1or2 years.Most work in Banbury or in the adjacent villages.A few commute to London / Manchester a increasing trend with the advent of the M40 Motorway development.Several U.S.A.F. men rent houses here whilst on assignment to Upper Heyford Base. The village primary school lies in the centre of the village and caters for 35 pupils age 5 to 11 from this and some surrounding villages,whose own schools have been closed for lack of pupils and economic pressures. Pupils leaving the school have an option of going to either the Banbury or Drayton Schools,both Comprehensives in the town centre and therefore a bus ride each day of five miles each way.
